alert.note: Alert for Coastal Kenedy; Inland Kenedy; Northern Hidalgo (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Kenedy, northeastern Hidalgo, southeastern Brooks and northwestern Willacy Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 259 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Norias to 6 miles southeast of Puerto Rico. Movement was south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Linn, San Manuel, Norias, Puerto Rico and Rudolph. This includes the following highways... US Highway 77 between mile markers 736 and 752. US Highway 281 between mile markers 744 and 760. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Kenedy; Inland Kenedy; Northern Hidalgo
